reviews.review: Jogo é muito bom, mas achei curto demais! Quando achei que começou a ficar apelativamente difícil, que imaginei que estava chegando no meio do jogo... acabou. Infelizmente a estória não é tão boa quanto a do BIOSHOCK 1, com aquele impacto que deu Andrew Ryan, o jogo também perdeu aquele ar sombrio, mudou totalmente o clima dos outros BIOSHOCKs, parece mais uma aventura de um mercenário do que uma luta por sobrevivência num cenário caótico de perder o folego como era no BIOSHOCK 1... mas fora isso, é um ótimo jogo, a ação é muito boa e a estória até é um pouco envolvente, os personagens são mais carismáticos, mas não tem o mesmo impacto do primeiro jogo.
One of the best games ive played :D!

Naprosto dokonalý příběh - řekl bych nejlepší, co jsem ve hrách zažil. Musel jsem si ho tedy po dohrání přečíst v celku, aby mi to všechno zapadlo (přece jen při krvavé přestřelce se těžko soustředí na mluvené slovo). Velice se mi líbilo také výtvarné zpracování a design celého světa. Nikdy bych neřekl, že střílečka může být takhle super. Vřele doporučuji.

Ich habe das Spiel als sehr sehr tolles Spielerlebens gesehen. Die Story ist leider sehr Kurz :/Ich war nach 7 Stunden Ingame Spielzeit durch. Wer auf Kurze Kompackte Story Spiele steht ist bei BioShock genau richtig. Ich würde es mir jederzeit wieder Kaufen. Zu wünschen wäre nur eine etwas längere Story.

Ich würde dem Spiel 4/5 Sternen Geben :D

Yeah they should of stoped at bioshock because every Iteration after wards has gotten Infinitly worse. Its like the Developers of this one decided to mash ratchet and clank together with this game and then hope that we wouldn't notice. Well, guess what guys... we noticed. We noticed it all throughout the game, except with less guns and less personality. Really, half way through this game i literally started to miss my gravity gun!!! Oh, and that gun that made a disco ball and had all my enemies dance while i compleatly wiped them out. Really this game was like trying to make love to a beautiful woman while thinking of the goofy girl from a couple years back. Which is not good. I mean when that starts to happen, then, thats bad. And not in a good way... In a bad way. And whin i say bad, I mean awful! Bad, bad, bad!!! And not nice at all. YUCK!!!
oK I i guess you get the point so I'll leave you with my final thoughts-
...

It is so rare that I get so deeply impressed by a game, as I did by Bioshock Infinite. This game almost made me cry, not because its a sad game or because I got it completed, but because its just so damm good. It makes it very hard to explain why it is so good, maybe by saying that if you buy this game, you will see things you have never seen before in a game. It is worth all your money, so go get it.

I was determined to play this game after coming across Claire Hummel's amazing concept art for some of its best characters.  My brother bought it during the Autumn Sale, and after playing through it on his account I bought a copy of my own during the Winter Sale (and I don't usually Buy Things - it's that good).  I haven't played the first two games yet, but that wasn't a problem - each game has a different story and new characters.

BioShock Infinite probably gets classified as a shooter most of the time, but don't expect it to be one, because that's not what it's about.  It's about the characters, the setting, and the story, and these things are beautiful.  If you're addicted to well-executed period films, you'll get the same buzz from this richly detailed universe.  The world of Columbia is filled with subtle touches which are every bit as amazing as the big things, so you'll get a lot out of the game if you sit back and take some time to explore each environment.  Go into the extra rooms.  Listen to all the voxophones.  There are lots of little stories to learn about if you keep your eyes and ears open.

Unless you're of a particularly sensitive disposition, don't be put off by the fact that the game has been called 'needlessly' and 'ridiculously' violent by various reviews.  There's some splashing blood, yes, and a bit of mutilation and decapitation occasionally, but once you're using a gun instead of your melee weapon you can stay further from the spray if you prefer.  That being said, there will be times when you will [i]want[/i] to melee people.  I don't often get emotionally involved in things, but this game has ensnared my mind and my soul, and my fighting style tends to change depending on the situation in which I find myself.

So if you love stories, or history, or music, or beautiful things, play BioShock Infinite - no, better yet: [i]live[/i] it - and, for Heaven's sake, SIT THROUGH THE CREDITS.

a siker érdekében eljátszották a hl2-ben bevállt "legyen egy segítőkészen harcias, de nőiesen riadt friendly npc", de alyxxal szemben ez a bula nincs mindig útban, és nem blokkol amikor teheti, VALAMINT leköti magát (teszemazt nézelődik, leül, harcnál megriad és arrébb megy fedezékbe)

Gioco bello ma incompiuto. La storia fa acqua come uno scolapasta, le tematiche ricche di spunti sono a malapena accennate e appiattite sotto il gameplay. Il gioco non fa che imboccare il giocatore rendendo il gameplay semplice e assurdamente lungo, con battaglie ottuse e nemici che sfidano qualsiasi logica umana ( ci sono anche i FANTASMI). 
Le uniche cose che salvano il gioco sono le musiche ed Elizabeth, forse i soli aspetti che si sono degnati di curare in un così deludente capitolo di una saga che sta precipitando nell'ovvietà.

Selon Moi l'un des meilleur jeux de 2013 un Gameplay fun et nerveux un histoire a couper le souffle (pour de vrai ;P) une ambiance année 1910 hyper immersive, de l'humour, des doublages vraiment reussi. A essayer de toute URGENCE !!!!
Nice Crazy story. Make a lot of fun to play on a Crazy World

Irrational Games does it again. I never would have thought it possible to overshadow the first Bioshock, Game of the Year in 2007, but they found a way to do it. Amazingly fun gameplay and great fluid controls. Graphics are unbelievable and you can really see the emotion on Elizabeths face as she goes thru all the turmoil of being a caged prisoner to roaming the streets of Columbia and seeing the world for what it is. The story telling is incredible, with a lot of twists and things to make you scratch your head. The story comes to a beautiful and mind blowing close in only the way Ken Levine can create. I cannot recommend this game enough for anyone who wants to enjoy some FPS action with some great story telling, and really, really fun skyhook battles. 10/10 and my Game of the Year choice for 2013.

A year later I can't say I ever really enjoyed this that much.  The art work and other aethestic talent poured into this game deserve props but the actual game underneath is a fairly linear, simple shooter.  Put bluntly,  on the PC it's a sprinkle-covered, hollowed-out dog turd but console-wise it's an enjoyable yet just slightly memorable experience that has a pretty face.

I completely recommend this game. From the start to mid game (current progress), I have gone through so many altered feelings in regards to the storyline. I'm in love with Elizabeth, and Booker Dewitt is one of the most sensible and perfect main characters I have ever played.  Absolutely beautiful game. I cannot stress anymore not JUST how immersive the game is, but how beautiful everything is around you too! Columbia is the most beautiful city I have ever experienced in my life whether it be a video game or real life. If you think about the game developing as criticially (if not more) as I have, you'd pause the game and sit there in shock for a moment. This game WILL bring me nostalgia, I WILL play the storyline through twice more, 10/10.

EDIT:

I just finished the game, and I was so overwhelmed at the storyline that I covered my mouth and tears ran down my face. This is the best Single Player Storyline game I have ever been fortunate enough to experience.

Сложно говорить об этом с невозмутимым лицом: я не просто прошел BioShock Infinite, я провел несколько дней в фантастическом, невероятном городе, сомневаться в реальности которого у меня нет ни единого повода.

I LOVE THIS GAME! I hear a lot of people hate on it, but most should find this game to be absolutely amazing, plus it only costed me $9.99 on steam! This is easily as good as the other Bioshock games, though a little easy on my first playthrough on hard, luckily if your like me you beat it and unlock 1999 mode(hardest one) and go again. I have yet to try the hardest one yet but I can happily vouch to say this game is awesome and worth 3+ playthroughs easily at first, then more and more later when you need a little something different back in your gaming world. Great Combat, Great Story, Great Graphics, A+++ 9/10 awesome

Hi everyone.This is my recommendation for the game Bioshock Infinity .
[b] BioShock Invinite [/b]-it's a great game !All is left to chance.The plot is fascinating and amazing battle.The game itself is the real world,which takes place in the sky,namely in the city,which flies in the sky.The plot is that a guy named Booker lost money in the card(as I understand) and to repay his debt,he must kidnap the main character of the game,Elizabeth,and give it to those who need it .In turn,Elizabeth is not just a girl ,and the girl with his "twist" .Elizabeth is the daughter of the Prophet Comstock(he founder of the air of the city) and it's locked in a tower in the same air base.She has a bodyguard,which was presented to her in case of danger(it looks like a monster iron eagle).Comstock,deceiving everyone wanted to Elizabeth became as he continued his work,but Elizabeth did not want it at all and hated him and despised.When we reach the point where it kidnaps her bodyguard ( iron eagle - robot),we begin to look for her.When we find her,she has grown old ... But, she shows us the future developments,which predicted Comstock.Elizabeth told us that it did not break anything but time.Time erases all and creates a new one.Elizabeth gives us a sheet with a message to his "I" in the past, in 1912,that we prevent anyone what will happen in the future,if we do not fix it and "teleported " to us that year. And what would happen next, learn yourself when to play this amazing game.Good and addictive game ! 
[b] Always yours, Jared Padalecki  [/b]
